normalised: **Real Estate and Property: Rental Agreement Realities!**

unnormalised: Mumbai: Finding that perfect chawl or swanky apartment in Bandra can be tough, but securing a fair rental agreement? Even tougher! Landlords, especially in cities like Delhi and Bangalore, are increasingly using e-agreements.
normalised: Mumbai: Finding that perfect chawl or swanky apartment in Bandra can be tough, but securing a fair rental agreement? Even tougher! Landlords, especially in cities like Delhi and Bangalore, are increasingly using e-agreements.

unnormalised: Experts like Dr. Sharma warn against blindly signing agreements. "Read the fine print!" he urges. Common gotchas include sky-high security deposits (sometimes 6 months’ rent!), sneaky clauses about maintenance, and restrictions on guests.
normalised: Experts like Doctor Sharma warn against blindly signing agreements. "Read the fine print!" he urges. Common gotchas include sky-high security deposits (sometimes six months’ rent!), sneaky clauses about maintenance, and restrictions on guests.

unnormalised: Rs. 500 stamp paper? Negotiate! And remember that oral agreements have little legal standing. Always document everything.
normalised: Rupee five hundred stamp paper? Negotiate! And remember that oral agreements have little legal standing. Always document everything.

unnormalised: A standard 2BHK in Powai, Mumbai, can easily cost Rs. 30,000, with a deposit hitting Rs. 1.8 lakhs. That’s a hefty sum!
normalised: A standard two B H K in Powai, Mumbai, can easily cost Rupee thirty thousand, with a deposit hitting Rupee one point eight lakhs. That’s a hefty sum!

unnormalised: Plus, watch out for clauses that increase rent by a whopping 10-15% annually. Is the 1000 sq ft space *really* worth it?
normalised: Plus, watch out for clauses that increase rent by a whopping ten to fifteen percent annually. Is the one thousand square feet space *really* worth it?

unnormalised: Remember, negotiating is your right! So channel your inner bargaining goddess (a la Sarojini Nagar market vibes!) and get the best deal possible!
normalised: Remember, negotiating is your right! So channel your inner bargaining goddess (a la Sarojini Nagar market vibes!) and get the best deal possible!
